alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 8:05AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 800 AM MDT... At 704 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Gordon to 19 miles south of Rushville. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Merriman, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Big Hill, Morgan Lake, Billys Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road, Diamond Lake, Highway 61 Crossing The Niobrara River, Intersection of Highway 61 and Shadbolt Road and Argo Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 99 and 142. Highway 250 between mile markers 17 and 35. Highway 61 between mile markers 199 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
